title: Exclusive: Sudan drops out of hunger-monitor system on eve of famine report - Reuters
summary:
Sudan Withdraws from Hunger-Monitoring System Ahead of Famine Report

Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Reuters

Sudan's government has suspended its participation in the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) system, coinciding with an anticipated report indicating a spread of famine across the country.

  • Sudan halts participation in Integrated Food Security Phase Classification.
  • IPC report expected to show famine spreading to five areas in Sudan.
  • NGOs fear withdrawal undermines efforts to address hunger crisis.
“Withdrawal from the IPC system won’t change the reality of hunger on the ground.”

Experts warn that Sudan's withdrawal may severely impact humanitarian efforts aimed at combating extreme hunger in the region.
newTitle: Sudan Withdraws from Hunger-Monitoring System Ahead of Famine Report

title: Iran lifts ban on WhatsApp, Google Play, week after pausing new hijab law - Hindustan Times
summary:
Iran Lifts Ban on WhatsApp and Google Play

Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Iran has lifted the ban on popular platforms WhatsApp and Google Play, marking a significant step in reducing internet restrictions enforced by the government.

  • The Iranian government announced the lifting of the ban as the first step in easing internet limitations.
  • Tehran's internet controls are among the strictest globally, but many Iranians bypass these using VPNs.
  • A majority vote was passed to allow access to these platforms during a meeting led by President Masoud Pezeshkian.
  • The lifting of the ban occurs shortly after Iran paused a new stricter law mandating women's hijab.
  • The law previously proposed heavier penalties on hijab violations but is now on hold due to its controversial nature.
“A positive majority vote has been reached to lift limitations on access to some popular foreign platforms...” - IRNA

The recent developments in Iran suggest a potential thaw in the country's approach to internet freedom and social regulations, though challenges remain in the political landscape.
newTitle: Iran Lifts Ban on WhatsApp and Google Play Amid Internet Censorship Easing

title: Eiffel Tower in Paris evacuated after fire in elevator: Report - Hindustan Times
summary:
Eiffel Tower fire: Around 1,200 tourists were evacuated following reports of the blaze, which was caused by an overheating cable in the lift shaft.

Date: Dec 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Eiffel Tower in Paris was evacuated on Tuesday morning after a fire broke out in one of its elevator shafts between the first and second floors. Around 1,200 tourists were evacuated following reports of the blaze, which was caused by an overheating cable in the lift shaft. Firefighters struggled to access the flames, but the fire was extinguished by midday.

  • 1,200 tourists evacuated.
  • Fire caused by an overheating cable in the elevator shaft.
  • Access to the tower restricted during firefighting operation.
  • The incident occurred hours after a separate fire near St Lazare train station.
“This fire incident reminds of the 1956 blaze in the Eiffel Tower's TV control room, which caused severe damage and required a year for repairs.”

The evacuation at the Eiffel Tower highlights ongoing concerns about fire safety at iconic landmarks, especially following recent high-profile incidents.
newTitle: Eiffel Tower Evacuated Due to Elevator Fire

title: Trump effect: Canada tightens immigration screws further, new curbs announced - ThePrint
summary:
Trump effect: Canada tightens immigration screws further, new curbs announced

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Continuing its efforts to curb illegal immigration, Canada announced that job offers will no longer give applicants an advantage in applying for permanent residence through the Express Entry program.

  • The new measures eliminate extra points for job offers in the Express Entry scoring system.
  • This change is intended to reduce fraud in the immigration process.
  • The policy addresses concerns raised by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump about undocumented migrants and fentanyl trade.
  • The announcement follows numerous changes to Canada's immigration policies as the country deals with record population growth and related challenges.
  • The 'flagpoling' process for obtaining work and study permits is also being eliminated.
“This temporary measure will reduce fraud by removing the incentive to illegally buy or sell labour market impact assessments.” - Marc Miller, Canadian Minister of Immigration

The new immigration regulations, effective in spring 2025, are part of Canada's broader strategy to secure its borders and manage population growth effectively.
newTitle: Canada Tightens Immigration Regulations Amid Trump's Pressure

title: American Airlines grounds all US flights due to 'technical issue' ahead of Christmas - Deccan Herald
summary:
American Airlines Grounds All US Flights Due to Technical Issues Ahead of Christmas

Published: 24 December 2024, 12:48 IST

American Airlines has grounded all its flights in the US due to technical issues, disrupting the holiday travel of thousands of passengers.

  • All US flights were halted due to unspecified technical issues.
  • Numerous passengers reported being stuck on the runway and returned to the gate.
  • American Airlines has not provided a formal statement or estimated time for resolution.
  • The airline operates thousands of flights per day, serving over 350 destinations globally.
  • This grounding follows a previous global tech outage affecting airlines months earlier.
Two years ago, Southwest Airlines experienced a meltdown during the holidays leading to 16,900 flight cancellations affecting 2 million passengers.

This incident has significant implications for holiday travel plans as the airline works to resolve the technical issues.
newTitle: American Airlines Grounds All US Flights Due to Technical Issues Ahead of Christmas

title: New Batch Of Sukhoi Su-57 Stealth Fighters Delivered To Russian MoD; Rostec CEO Calls It “King Of The Sky” - EurAsian Times
summary:
New Batch Of Sukhoi Su-57 Stealth Fighters Delivered To Russian MoD; Rostec CEO Calls It "King Of The Sky"

Publication Date: Not specified Source: EurAsian Times

The United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) has delivered a new batch of Su-57 Felon and Su-34 Fullback combat aircraft to the Russian Ministry of Defense, marking a significant enhancement of Russia's aerial capabilities.

  • Rostec CEO Sergei Chemezov described the Su-57 as the "king of the sky" and praised its advanced capabilities.
  • The Su-57 is designed for various combat missions and can target air, ground, and sea threats in challenging conditions.
  • The Su-34 is a capable fighter-bomber that can engage long-distance targets despite enemy jamming efforts.
  • This delivery indicates a steady expansion of Russia’s aerial capabilities amidst ongoing challenges.
  • Russia has faced significant aircraft losses since the invasion of Ukraine, which has affected production and delivery rates.
  • Western sanctions have hindered sourcing of vital components, pushing Russia to rely on alternative suppliers.
“The Su-57 and Su-34 are among the best in their class. They address critical tasks while showcasing superior maneuverability and combat performance.” - Vadim Badekha, head of the UAC

The ongoing production and delivery of these aircraft reflect Russia's commitment to enhancing its military capabilities despite external challenges and setbacks.
newTitle: New Batch Of Sukhoi Su-57 Stealth Fighters Delivered To Russian MoD; Rostec CEO Calls It "King Of The Sky"

title: Who is Amelia Carter? Is she really the victim of the NYC subway horror? - The Times of India

summary:
Elon Musk Responds to Immigration Views of Trump Aide Sriram Krishnan

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Elon Musk criticized the controversy around Sriram Krishnan's immigration views, describing opposing opinions as a “fixed pie” fallacy during his induction as a senior White House Policy Advisor.

  • Musk took to X to share his thoughts on the debates surrounding green card caps.
  • Krisnan's stance aims to remove country caps for green cards, which he believes would enhance skilled immigration.
  • David Sacks clarified that Krishnan supports skills-based criteria for green cards, not an unlimited immigration program.
  • Several tech leaders, including Joe Lonsdale, defended Krishnan's appointment and views.
“The ‘fixed pie’ fallacy is at the heart of much wrong-headed economic thinking. There is essentially infinite potential for job and company creation.” - Elon Musk

This discourse highlights important themes around immigration reform, economic policy, and national leadership in AI, particularly in the context of Trump's administration.
newTitle: Elon Musk Responds to Immigration Views of Trump Aide Sriram Krishnan

  • Dropped out of her PhD to focus on being a full-time content creator on OnlyFans.
  • Clarified that she is of mixed background: American, Persian, Southern European, Middle Eastern, and Indian.
  • Addressed misconceptions regarding her name causing confusion with another influencer.

title: Pope to open Holy Door in a prison: a message of hope to prisoners - vaticannews.va
South Korean opposition postpones decision to impeach acting president - CNA
summary:
South Korean Opposition Delays Impeachment Decision for Acting President Han Duck-soo

Publication Date: December 24, 2023

Source: Channel News Asia

The South Korean opposition has chosen to postpone a decision to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, initially set for Christmas Eve, until December 26, allowing for further evaluation of the situation.

  • The opposition Democratic Party decided not to present an impeachment motion on December 24 as intended.
  • This decision followed Han’s refusal to enact special Bills aimed at investigating the impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol.
  • Park Chan-dae, the party’s floor leader, expressed a desire to consider public sentiments before proceeding.
  • Yoon Suk Yeol faces allegations tied to an interim martial law declaration and corruption claims against his wife, Kim Keon Hee.
  • The impeachment process requires six favorable votes from the nine-member Constitutional Court.
“We have decided to exercise patience, taking into account the sentiments of the people, and wait until the 26th to determine whether our demands are met.” - Park Chan-dae

In summary, the Democratic Party's strategic delay reflects a careful approach to a highly contentious political situation in South Korea.
newTitle: South Korean Opposition Delays Impeachment Decision for Acting President Han Duck-soo

title: Mob justice replaces extrajudicial killings in Yunus-led interim govt in Bangladesh, stability hangs in balance - The Hindu
summary:
Mob Justice Sur replaces Extrajudicial Killings in Yunus-led Interim Govt in Bangladesh, Stability Hangs in Balance

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

In recent months, Bangladesh has experienced a surge in mob justice with incidents escalating after the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. The interim government, led by Dr. Muhammad Yunus, has been unable to restore law and order amidst increasing violence.

  • Abdul Hai Kanu, a 78-year-old freedom fighter, was publicly humiliated and assaulted by a mob on December 22, highlighting the rise in mob justice.
  • Over 82 people were killed due to mob incidents in just four months under the interim government.
  • Despite police presence, fear among officers leads to reluctance in intervention during violent incidents.
  • The country has seen a sharp rise in robbery and muggings, with at least 10 killed in Dhaka alone during this period.
  • Human rights groups have reported a significant increase in fabricated legal cases during this time.
“We are deeply concerned about mob justice. Police are not intervening, leading people to believe they can act without police interference.” - Advocate Saidur Rahman

While mob violence has surged, there has been a noted decline in extrajudicial killings, previously rampant under the ousted regime. However, as political instability continues, the question of law and order remains critical in Bangladesh.
newTitle: Mob Justice Surges in Bangladesh Amid Political Turmoil

Gay Couple Sentenced to 100 Years for Raping and Filming Abuse of Adopted Sons

Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A US court sentenced a gay couple to 100 years in prison without the possibility of parole for raping two special needs sons they adopted. The couple, under the guise of a happy home, reportedly sexually abused the kids, recorded pedophilic pornography, and offered the kids to their friends. The abuse came to light when child sexual abuse material was uploaded to a Google account in 2022.

  1. The couple was convicted of aggravated sodomy, sexual exploitation of children, and child molestation.
  2. The victims are now 12 and 10 years old.
  3. The men reportedly bragged about the abuse to their friends.

“These two Defendants truly created a house of horrors and put their extremely dark desires above everything and everyone else” - Randy McGinley, District Attorney

The couple pleaded guilty to the charges and were sentenced to 100 years in prison without the possibility of parole.

title: ‘It’s God’s will,’ Russia’s top Islamic body withdraws ruling that allowed men to have four wives - WION
summary:
Russia's Islamic Body Withdraws Ruling on Polygamy After Backlash

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: WION

Russia's top Islamic body has withdrawn a controversial fatwa that allowed Muslim men to have multiple wives after facing significant backlash and legal challenges from officials and the public.

  • The Islamic body originally issued a fatwa on Dec 17 outlining conditions for Muslim men to have up to four wives, contingent upon providing equal support and living spaces.
  • The fatwa faced immediate condemnation, leading Russian officials to highlight its conflict with Russian law, which outlaws polygamy.
  • Officials noted that the ruling violated core Russian morals and traditional values, prompting a public outcry.
  • After being notified by the Prosecutor General’s Office about the ruling's unlawfulness, the Islamic body rescinded the document.
  • The chairman of the council stated, “It is God’s will. The Council of Scholars sees no sense in joining a debate on the matter.”
  • Muslims constitute about 10% of Russia's population, with significant communities in various regions.
“The main condition for allowing polygamy is a fair and equal treatment of all wives by their husband.”

This incident highlights the tension between religious practices and national laws in Russia, especially concerning the rights of Muslim communities.
newTitle: Russia's Islamic Body Withdraws Ruling on Polygamy After Backlash
